pros: Pay, appreciation, good vibe, happy coworkers

review_title: Not the best place to work
pros: I enjoyed my coworkers and my manager.
cons: Resources were always limited. It was difficult to get through the stack of referrals due to lack of staff, which meant we couldn’t see as many patients as we would have liked.

job_title: Materials Management Specialist in Hermiston, OR

pros: Good hospital and staff, overall nice co-workers (but that is changing as long time staff leave; see below).
cons: New administration all about "change" (which is needed). However they are making changes without talking to nurses or doctors. This is leading to significant staff turnover and dissatisfaction. Employee morale is very low. Loyalty to staff does not appear to factor into any decisions, as they are made. Again its all "business". Very far from an ideal work environment to be in, which is very unfortunate.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Longview, TX
pros: Supportive staff. Great place to begin a nursing career.
cons: Erratic at times, patient load can be difficult to manage at times as well. Welcome to nursing.

pros: More than 2 years with my employment at GSMC and I've decided the excitement of working here isn't a phase. I love the management, they encourage employees to grow and learn with the company. And as fast as I've seen things go I've learned just as much if not more. There is no micromanaging in my department, but rather a trust we are all working together to meet our goals. The director of my department has been the coolest guy and knows how to help the team push for success. 1 year in with this guy and he's built an outstanding team to work with.
cons: There was a time when I wasn't receiving the feedback I was hoping to improve. But this was not a short coming of management. It was a time of growth and we didn't have anyone leading our team at the time. Upper management was taking the proper lengths to make sure we got the right guy to lead our team

pros: Best hospital system for patients to choose in East Texas. Level II trauma center. Large NICU with excellent staff. Self governed, so no large hospital system to impose regulations. This hospital system is dedicated to the community and follows the principles of servant leadership. GSMC provides pro-bono work for community members when there is a need, knowing that the patient can not pay. New CEO (not Ed Banos) sends weekly email updates about finances, staffing, patient praises/complaints. Feeling of unity among co-workers.
cons: Company is in the midst of some trying financial times...raises currently on hold; however, we are projected to be back on track within the next 6 months. Recently had to withdraw reimbursement for CEU fees, license/registration fees, and incentive pay.

pros: I work with some of the best staff around. The nurses here have great critical thinking skills and they are willing to teach any time. I started my nursing career here. I left for a while and came back because I found out that not every hospital is as good as this one. This used to be the lowest paid hospital in the area, but since the buyout, pay has gotten better. Personally, the clinical director on my unit is the best boss I have ever worked for.
cons: We are often spread thin due to lack of staff. The patient to staff ratios are difficult on some floors.

pros: Work nights. You get shift diff, plus a $200 bonus per extra day worked.
cons: We've been changing managers. Lots of new rules/be to deal with, and they arent very accommodating when it causes problems.

pros: Great people, good benefits, loved the on-site gym and access to the Institute for Healthy Living, in a great city too!
cons: Working at a hospital means you deal a lot with an angry customer - not the companies fault but just the type of people you usually deal with on a day to day basis

pros: Vacation can build up, great place to learn, multiple locations, with various departments, rewarding to be able to help people, co-workers become an extended family
cons: Co-workers are extended family you love and hate one another, red tape that goes with being part of a small community.

pros: Great place to work, good sense of community
cons: Easy to feel overworked at this place

pros: Great Culture.  Servant Leadership philosophy demonstrated by CEO. Large system with career advancement opportunities.
cons: Some areas are understaffed.  Hospital Facility therefore open 24/7 including holidays.

pros: Great facility, we'll trained supervisors, safe invironment.
cons: Things are always changing, system upgrades, healthcare regulations.
